intro: Rauvolfia paucifolia, commonly known as the Indian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia, Africa, and the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Rauvolfia paucifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
